document.docAuthor: Liu, Zhen, He, Jun-Hua, Chen, Xue-Xin & Gupta, Ankita
document.masterDocTitle: The ater-group of the genus Apanteles Foerster (Hymenoptera, Braconidae, Microgastrinae) from China with the descriptions of forty-eight new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The ater-group of the genus Apanteles Foerster (Hymenoptera, Braconidae, Microgastrinae) from China with the descriptions of forty-eight new species

bibRefCitation.author: Nixon, G. E. J.
bibRefCitation.refString: Nixon, G. E. J. (1965) A reclassification of the tribe Microgasterini (Hymenoptera: Braconidae). Bulletin of the British Museum (Natural History), Entomology Series, Supplement 2, 1 - 284.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Apanteles cypris Nixon, 1965: 47
. Holotype ♀ —Luzon, Philippines [USNM].
Shenefelt, 1972: 486
; Watanabe, 1967: 189–198; You & Xiong, 1982: 58; Zheng &
Yang, 1981: 11–66
; Chen & Song, 2001: 535–538;
Chen & Song, 2004: 44
;
Chou, 1979: 303
.

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. Body length 2.7 mm , fore wing length 3.2 mm . Body black, hind femur mostly brownish. Ocelli small, posterior tangent to anterior ocellus touching posterior ocelli, distance between fore and hind ocellus as long as diameter of hind ocellus. Antenna slightly longer than body length, penultimate flagellomere 1.8× longer than wide. Interspaces between punctures on disc of mesonotum not smaller than its diameter. Areola on propodeum strongly defined, diamond-shaped, closed with strong costulae. Pterostigma 2.8× as long as its widest part, vein 1-R1 1.2× longer than pterostigma, vein r 1.9× longer than vein 2-SR, curved at junction. T1 nearly parallel-sided, short, 1.3× longer than hind width, turned-over part slightly transverse, shiny with strong rugosity, longitudinal channel distinct and broad; T2 shiny and nearly polished, 4.5× wider than long in the middle; T3 2.0× longer than T2. Ovipositor sheath 0.9 of hind tibia.

Hosts. According to literature,
Cnaphalocrocis medinalis (Güenée)
,
C. suspicalis (Güenée)
and
Mehteria hemidoxa
[
Piper nigrum
] (
Yu et al . 2016
).
